intro: Lindmania flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid lindmania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense, woolly coating. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Lindmania flaccida is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
